text: Antigen complexed with major histocompatibility complex class I or II molecules on the surface of antigen presenting cells interacts with the T cell receptor ( TCR ) on the surface of T cells and initiates an activation cascade .
So called costimulatory signals , mediated by other cell surface interactions or soluble cytokines produced by antigen presenting cells , are also required for complete T cell activation .
High levels of cytokine gene expression in T cells also required both TCR and costimulatory signals .

The <extra_id_0> granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> requires sequences in the promoter as well as a powerful enhancer located 3kb upstream to respond to TCR-like signals .

text: These promoter and enhancer regions are mainly activated by the transcription factor nuclear factor of activated T cells ( NFAT ) .

The activation of NFAT by TCR signals has been well described for <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene transcription in T cells .

text: Costimulatory signals , such as activation of the <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cell surface molecule on T cells , lead to activation through a distinct region of the <extra_id_0> granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) promoter .

text: This region is termed the CK-1 or CD28RE and appears to bind specific members of the NF-kappa B family of transcription factors .
Human T leukemia virus type 1 ( HTLV-1 ) infects T cells and can lead to increase <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

text: We have found that the HTLV-1 transactivator protein , <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , acts as a costimulatory signal for <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene transcription , in that it can cooperate with TCR signals to mediate high level gene expression .

text: However , other transcription factors or coactivators of NF-kappa B are required for <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation but these remain to be identified .

The CK-1 / CD28RE of <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> shows a high degree of similarity to the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> CD28RE and the <extra_id_0> IL-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene also contains a related region .

This observation , together with the fact that both <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> respond to TCR signals via NFAT , implies a high degree of conservation in the regulation of cytokine gene expression in T cells .
